indicators.justification:
The main source of the information based on polluters on national level is the Integrated pollution register. (1)

It provides data to European Environment Agency. (2)

Data on pollution measurement is provided by Czech Hydrometeorological Institute (3)

2) European Environment AgencyL Data and Maps, https://www.eea.europa.eu/data-and-maps

3) Historical air data, https://www.chmi.cz/historicka-data/ovzdusi

indicators.justification:
The registration of beneficial owners has existed in Czech legislation since 1 January 2018 in the Act on Public Registers of Legal Entities and Natural Persons No. 304/2013 Coll., § 118b - § 118j (1). However, this information was available only to very limited audience (Courts of law, police, etc.) and not to the general public or media.

Since the time period of the study is May 1st 2019 – May 1st 2021, the answers to the data availability is "Not available".

However, the situation has changed drastically since.

With effect from 1 June 2021, the Act on the Registration of Beneficial Owners No. 37/2021 Coll. (2) transposed the regulation contained in the so-called V. AML (anti-money-laundering) Directive (3) - i.e. Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering or terrorist financing and Directives 2009/138/EC and 2013/36/EU. This amendment came more than a year later than the deadline foreseen by the Directive.

The latter act established the Register of Beneficial Owners, which is online since 1st June 2021 (4). This Register contains information about beneficial owners of companies registered in the Czech Republic.

Since June 2021:
The Register contains information about: Names, date of birth (month and year), nationality, country of residence, type of beneficial ownership.

The ID is a national identification number.
No explicit license is provided. However data are freely available according to the law. There are technical restrictions in place: "Due to the nature of the WWW server's operation and security, the Department of Justice reserves the right to restrict or prohibit access to the database to any user who sends more than 3,000 requests per day for processing and/or attempts to exceed the protection of this WWW server and/or who sends more than 50 requests for processing within one minute."

The dataset is provided only as a searchable database.

Data is updated daily.

The duty to list beneficial ownership is very new (June 2021) and there are:
a) transition period during which companies have to register their beneficial owners,
b) no judicial decisions in case of missing or incorrect information
c) well known case - biggest Czech e-commerce company Alza.cz - where the information provided is very doubtful with respect to its correctness (common knowledge is that the owner is still the founder Aleš Zavoral, however he is not listed in the Register).

(1) Parlament ČR. 2013. Zákon č. 304/2013 Sb. Zákon o veřejných rejstřících právnických a fyzických osob. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2013-304#cast5

(2) Parlament ČR. 2021. Zákon č. 37/2021 Sb. Zákon o evidenci skutečných majitelů. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2021-37

(3) European Union. 2018. Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purposes of money laundering or terrorist financing, and amending Directives 2009/138/EC and 2013/36/EU. https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32018L0843&qid=1626044899667

(4) Ministerstvo spravedlnosti ČR. 2021. Evidence skutečných majitelů. https://esm.justice.cz/

evidence.title: Act on Public Registers of Legal Entities and Natural Persons No. 304/2013 Coll., § 118b - § 118j.
Act on the Registration of Beneficial Owners No. 37/2021 Coll.
Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council

Most of the questions are not really applicable.

indicators.justification:
Every "obliged entity", which is required to provide information through FOIA requests, is also obliged to publish annual report containing information about the FOIA requests it received.

All answers to FOIA requests and the annual reports (usually .pds or .doc) need to be also accessible online. (1)

Most of the questions are not therefore applicable.

1) Freedom of Information Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

indicators.justification:
The public consultation processes for executive rulemaking is non existent in most cases. It may be used ad-hoc by ministerial or governmental decision. If so, it is not standard and generally no standard data is collected.

The only exception is the Energy Regulatory Office, which is obliged by law to consult stakeholders and respond to received comments. (1).

Most of the sub-questions are therefore not applicable.

1) Energy Act, 458/2000 Coll. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2000-458#p17e

responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
The data includes proposed regulations.
The data includes a full set of public comments generated through public consultation processes.
The data includes supporting information, such as notices of intent and reasoned responses.
The data includes final regulations and justifications.
The data includes details of challenges to regulations that have passed through public consultation processes, as well as the results of these challenges.
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

responses.response_text: There is no evidence of data gaps.
responses.subquestion_text: This information is missing required data.
The availability of this data has been affected by government response to COVID-19.

indicators.justification:
The main source of the information is Register of Contracts (1), where most of the public contracts must be published, otherwise the contract after a period of one month is void and null.

The notable exceptions are smaller municipalities, which do not have to publish the contracts.

The procurement phase is covered by Journal of Public Procurements (2). However, it does not provide open data.

1) Register of Contracts, https://smlouvy.gov.cz/

2) Journal of Public Procurements, https://www.vestnikverejnychzakazek.cz/

responses.response_text: Data is available from government, or because of government actions.
responses.subquestion_text: Is this data available online in any form?
Procurement related to goods and services is included.
Procurement related to public works is included.
The planning phase is covered.
The tender stage is covered.
The award stage is covered.
The contract implementation stage is covered.
The data contains identifiers or other features that connect together data on each stage of a single procurement process.
The data contains names and unique identifiers for companies awarded contracts.
The data contains start and end dates for tender processes and/or contracts.
The data contains the value (cost) of each tender, award, or contract
The data contains, or can be linked to, information on spending against the contract.
The data contains a description of the goods, services or works being procured.
The data is published according to one or more relevant data standards.
The data contains links to accessible tender, award, or contract documentation
Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is openly licensed.
Data is available in all the country’s official or national languages. If the country has no official or national languages, data is available in the major languages of the country.
There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

responses.response_text: There is evidence that a portion of mandated data is missing.
responses.subquestion_text: This information is missing required data.
The availability of this data has been affected by government response to COVID-19.

responses.response_text: The data assessed covers, or is representative of the data available for, a large proportion of public procurement but some gaps in coverage exist.
responses.subquestion_text: How comprehensive is the data assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
There is only limited support provided by the government to disseminate the open data.

There is an annual hackathon Hackuj stát (Hack the state) (1) 

Most of the information is provided by the Open Data Team of Ministry of Interior on the Open Data Portal (2) (3)

The best updated information available and communication platform is by following Twitter accounts, mainly the Offical Account of Czech National #OpenData Coordinator.

1) Hack the state - hackathon, https://hackujstat.cz/

2) Open Data in the Czech Republic: portal for providers, https://opendata.gov.cz/start

3) Open Data Portal, https://data.gov.cz/

4) Offical Account of Czech National #OpenData Coordinator, https://twitter.com/otevrenadata

evidence.title: Open Data in the Czech Republic: portal for providers
Offical Account of Czech National #OpenData Coordinator

responses.response_text: There is some evidence of government supporting and encouraging data reuse.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of a government strategy to support and encourage data reuse?
There is evidence of government efforts to support open government data reuse.
There is evidence of government efforts to support big data reuse in a general sense.
There is evidence of government efforts to support private sector or NGO data reuse.
There is evidence of government efforts to support crowdsourced data reuse.
There is evidence of government efforts to support data reuse from various data topics.
There is evidence of government efforts to support data reuse by civil society organizations.
There is evidence of government efforts to support data reuse by media.
There is evidence of government efforts to support data reuse by scholars and academic institutions.
There is evidence of government efforts to support data reuse by the private sector.
Government support for data reuse involves data challenges.
Government support for data reuse involves hackathons.
Government support for data reuse involves communication and community building efforts.
Government support for data reuse involves running information sessions on how to use particular datasets, or how to reuse government data in general.
Government support for data reuse involves the release of funding schemes

responses.response_text: Support is given in one or more localities, but there are many other localities without such support, or with support of a lesser quality.
responses.subquestion_text: How comprehensive, in terms of jurisdiction, is the coverage of the support assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
The governmental open data initiative is led by Ministry of Interior, it also runs the Open Data Portal, which is the main source of information on the topic for other civil servants. (1) (4)

Particularly for governmental organizations, there is Portal for Providers [of open data]. (2)

The further information on situation on regional level may be assessed from National Catalogue of Open Data. (3)

1) Open Data Portal, https://data.gov.cz/

2) Open Data in the Czech Republic: portal for providers, https://opendata.gov.cz/start

3) National Catalogue of Open Data, https://opendata.gov.cz/start

4) Freedom of Access to Information Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

evidence.title: Open Data in the Czech Republic: portal for providers
Freedom of Access to Information Act

responses.response_text: There is evidence of an active government-led open government data initiative.
responses.subquestion_text: Has there been any form of government-led open government data initiative during the study period?
There is a government team in place supporting open data activities.
There is an allocated budget for open data activities.
There is a well-maintained open data portal.
There is guidance and support for government publication of open data.
Senior political leaders back the open data initiative.

responses.response_text: The open data initiative covers much of the national government, and there are similar initiatives in many sub-national areas.
responses.subquestion_text: How widely does this, or similar, open data initiatives apply?

indicators.justification:
National Open Data Catalogue provides a basic overview on this topic, showing cities and regions publishing open data. (1)

There are over 6,000 municipalities in CZ and 13 regions,vast  majority of them do not provide any open data.

On the other hand, there are good examples of cities providing data and open data: Prague, Brno, Plzeň among others. (2) (3) (4)

1) National Open Data Catalogue, https://data.gov.cz/datov%C3%A9-sady

2) Prague: Golemio - Let's make decisions based on data!, https://golemio.cz/

3) Data portal of the city of Brno, https://data.brno.cz/

4) Plzeň: Open data, https://opendata.plzen.eu/

evidence.title: Prague: Golemio - Let's make decisions based on data!
Data portal of the city of Brno

responses.response_text: There is evidence of limited or ad-hoc capability to effectively manage data.
responses.subquestion_text: To what extent do city, regional, and local governments have the capability to effectively manage data?
There is evidence of local governments having open data initiatives.
There is evidence of local governments having current open data policies in place.
There is evidence of local governments having rules and or guidance in place to provide a comprehensive framework for data sharing.
There is evidence of local governments having rules and or guidance in place for consistent data management and publication.
There is evidence of local governments providing training to civil servants on data literacy and skills.
There is evidence of local governments providing support for data reuse.

responses.response_text: The examples given are exceptions: the majority of cities and regions do not have the capacity to effectively manage data.
responses.subquestion_text: How widespread are local capacities to effectively manage data?

indicators.justification:
This kind of training is not widespread in Czechia.

Open data team of Ministry of Interior is providing such training to public organizations (1)

However the number of participants is very limited comparing to number of public organizations.

1) Open data: trainings archive, https://opendata.gov.cz/edu:%C5%A1kolen%C3%AD:archiv

responses.response_text: There is isolated evidence of government supporting civil servants training on data matters.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of  government´s actions to train civil servants on data matters?
Training delivered covers data frameworks and governance topics.
Training delivered to public servants covers topics on data gathering.
Training delivered covers data analysis, visualisations and storytelling techniques.
Training delivered covers specific technical topics for data centred roles.
Training on data addresses non-technical public servants.
Training on data is focused on specific positions already working with data.
Training is planned by an established training team, department, or agency.
Public servants receive a certification when taking a training so there is a formal recognition as a professional development.

responses.response_text: The training assessed is available to one or more agencies or ministries, but there are many other agencies or ministries without such training.
responses.subquestion_text: How widespread, in terms of agencies and ministries, are the trainings assessed for this question?

responses.response_text: Assessed training involves sub-national or local public servants of one or more localities, but there are many other localities without such trainings.
responses.subquestion_text: How widespread, in terms of jurisdictions, are trainings assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
Every "obliged entity", which is required to provide information through FOIA requests, is also obliged to publish annual report containing information about the FOIA requests it received.

All answers to FOIA requests and the annual reports (usually .pds or .doc) need to be also accessible online. (1)

Some sub-questions are not applicable.

1) Freedom of Information Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

responses.response_text: The datasets use a limited number of common identifiers.
responses.subquestion_text: There is evidence that datasets share common identifiers.
The key datasets for this theme share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The different political integrity datasets use common identifiers for public officials.
Lobbying data and political finance data share common identifiers for lobbyist clients and party and campaign donors.
Lobbying registers and public consultation data use common identifiers for regulations.
Asset declarations and political finance disclosures share common identifiers for interests, assets, and liabilities.
The various datasets share common identifiers for legal persons associated with donations, interests, assets, liabilities, and lobbying activities.
The key datasets for the political integrity and company information modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and land modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public finance modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public procurement modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.

responses.response_text: There is partial consistency; several categories of identifiers are consistent across multiple datasets or whole identification systems are consistent across at least two datasets.
responses.subquestion_text: To what degree do the datasets associated with this theme use consistent identifiers and identification systems for elements that appear in more than one dataset?

indicators.justification:
The main bill regulating the topic is valid since January 2021.
the Act on the Registration of Beneficial Owners No. 37/2021 Coll. (1) transposed the regulation contained in the so-called V. AML (anti-money-laundering) Directive (2) - i.e. Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering or terrorist financing and Directives 2009/138/EC and 2013/36/EU. This amendment came more than a year later than the deadline foreseen by the Directive.

1) Act on the Registration of Beneficial Owners No. 37/2021 Coll., https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2021-37

2) Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering or terrorist financing and Directives 2009/138/EC and 2013/36/EU. https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32018L0843

evidence.title: Act on the Registration of Beneficial Owners No. 37/2021 Coll.

Directive (EU) 2018/843 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 May 2018 amending Directive (EU) 2015/849 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering or terrorist financing and Directives 2009/138/EC and 2013/36/EU.

Definitions comprehensively cover ownership.

indicators.justification:
The accessibility of public information (not only data) is controlled by Act 99/2019 Coll.: Act on Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications and on Amendments to Act No. 365/2000 Coll., on Public Administration Information Systems and on Amendments to Certain Other Acts, as amended (1)

The duties for public organizations may be found in several texts, for example in Ensuring web accessibility is also an obligation for schools (2)

1) Act 99/2019 Coll.: Act on Accessibility of Websites and Mobile Applications

2) Ensuring web accessibility is also an obligation for schools, https://www.marketing-dome.cz/zajistit-pristupnost-webu-je-povinnost-i-pro-skoly/

The topic is regulated by FOIA. (1)

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
There are minimum standards for metadata when government data is catalogued or published.
There is a standardised process for publishing and updating published government data.
There are technical standards, including common data models, codelists, and identifiers for management and publication of government data.
There are clearly documented quality control processes for government data.
There are clearly documented processes for soliciting and integrating feedback from external users to improve data quality.

responses.response_text: The data management approaches assessed apply to a limited number of departments or localities.
responses.subquestion_text: How broadly is good data management practice established?

indicators.justification:
The FOIA (106/1999( is used as the legal base for such sharing (open data, etc.), particularly in its Section 4 and following sections. (1)

There is no general framework for inter-governmental sharing of data, etc.

1) Act No. 106/1999 Coll.Act on Free Access to Information, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework covers data sharing within government.
The framework covers how government should share data with other sectors.
The framework covers data sharing from other sectors to government.

indicators.justification:
The data protection is regulated by Personal Data Processing Act (110/2019) - GDPR (1)

Detailed information may be found on European website Complete guide to GDPR compliance (2).

Because the law transposes the EU regulation, which deals with location-related data, the Czech law should also apply to this area, but it is not mentioned explicitly.

1) Act No. 110/2019 Coll.Personal Data Processing Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2019-110

2) Complete guide to GDPR compliance, https://gdpr.eu/

evidence.title: Act No. 110/2019 Coll.Personal Data Processing Act

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework provides data subjects with rights of choice or consent.
The framework provides data subjects with rights to access and correct data about themselves.
The framework sets out clear responsibilities for data holders.
The framework provides rights of redress
The framework requires data controllers to notify an appropriate authority of data breaches.
Frameworks explicitly cover the protection of location-related data.
The framework addresses algorithmic decision making.
Exceptions to the usual data protection framework have been made as part of the country's COVID-19 response.

responses.response_text: The framework applies widely across all sectors (including public and private sector).
responses.subquestion_text: How broadly does this data protection framework apply?

responses.response_text: The framework assessed, or equivalent frameworks, apply across the whole country.
responses.subquestion_text: Does this framework apply across the whole country?

indicators.justification:
The rights of ethnic minorities are defined by Act No. 273/2001 Coll.Act on the Rights of Members of National Minorities and on Amendments to Certain Acts. (1)

This is not applicable for data in general.

Top reason not to support other languages is because Czech or mutually understandable Slovak is mother tongue for about 98% of population. (2)

1) Act No. 273/2001 Coll.Act on the Rights of Members of National Minority, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2001-273

2) Czech as a "non-native" language in the Czech Republic, http://sas.ujc.cas.cz/archiv.php?lang=en&art=3742

indicators.justification:
The main legislative covering open data is part of Freedom of Access to Information Act 106/1999 Coll. (1) It covers definition and publication of open data, it establishes National open data catalogue (2).

The guidance is mainly provided by Ministry of Interior (3), which is the part of the government responsible for coordination of opening data in the Czech republic.

(1) Parlament ČR. 1999. Zákon č. 106/1999 Sb. Zákon o svobodném přístupu k informacím. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

(2) Ministerstvo vnitra ČR. 2019. Národní katalog otevřených dat. https://data.gov.cz/datov%C3%A9-sady

(3) Ministerstvo vnitra ČR. 2021. Vzdělávání v oblasti otevřených dat. https://data.gov.cz/vzd%C4%9Bl%C3%A1v%C3%A1n%C3%AD/

evidence.title: Freedom of Access to Information Act

responses.response_text: A framework exists and has the force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework establishes a common definition of open data.
The framework promotes open licensing without any restrictions beyond attribution and share-alike.
The framework requires to publish data in machine readable formats.
The rules/guidance requires the use of specific data standards.
The framework promotes training and capacity building among government officials.

responses.response_text: The relevant laws, policies and guidance assessed cover the majority of localities and government agencies.
responses.subquestion_text: How widely do these laws, regulations, policies or guidance apply?

indicators.justification:
This topic is supervised by Ministry of Finance as decreed by The Accounting Act (1). It stipulates that some 18,000 entities (municipalities and their organizations, other public entities) are required to provide the Ministry of Finance with their financial data regularly (monthly to yearly).

Other technical details are in the Decree 383/2009 (2).

This data is published by the Ministry on its portal Monitor - Complete overview of public finance (3).

1) The Accounting Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1991-563/

2) Decree 383/2009 on accounting records in technical form of selected accounting units and their transmission to the central accounting information system of the state and on requirements for technical and mixed forms of accounting records (technical decree on accounting records), https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2009-383

3) Monitor - Complete overview of public finance, https://monitor.statnipokladna.cz/

4) Act on budgetary rules. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2000-218

evidence.title: Decree on accounting records in technical form of selected accounting units and their transmission to the central accounting information system of the state and on requirements for technical and mixed forms of accounting records (technical decree on accounting records)
Monitor - Complete overview of public finance

indicators.justification:
The basic law is Conflict of Interest Act 159/2006. (1)

It defines who is required to provide data on income and assets of public officials.

It also states that such information is provided to anybody for free, but they have to ask specifically for it. This basically forbid providing the information as open data.

The information may be found (after request) in Central register of notifications (2)

1) Conflict of Interest Act 159/2006, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2006-159

2) Central register of notifications, https://cro.justice.cz/

The framework requires collecting specific information on in-kind and non-financial support.
The framework requires collecting information on significant changes in assets and liabilities.
The framework requires disclosure of income and assets held by a public official's spouse, family members, or other intimates.

The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The framework requires the publication of income and asset declarations.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
The topic is generally regulated by Legislative Act on Association in Political Parties and Political Movements (1)

It is supervised by Office for Supervision over the Management of Political Parties and Movements (2)

The details are provided opinion of the Office or/and in special website of the Office's vice chairman (3)

Information on political finances are provided in more user friendly way by an independent project run by a NGO (4)

campaign finance is governed by Acts, which govern various types of elections, e.g. the parliamentary one (5)

1) Act on Association in Political Parties and Political Movements, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1991-424

2) Office for Supervision over the Management of Political Parties and movements, https://www.udhpsh.cz/

3) Independent website run by the Vice Chairman of the Office for Supervision over the Management of Political Parties and movements, https://outly.cz/?page_id=1803

4) Independent project showing political finances, https://www.politickefinance.cz/

5) Act on Elections to the Parliament of the Czech Republic and on Amendments and Additions to Certain Other Acts, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1995-247

How comprehensive, in terms of jurisdiction, is the coverage of the laws, regulations, policies, or guidance assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
The public consultation processes for executive rulemaking is non existent in most cases. It may be used ad-hoc by ministerial or governmental decision. If so, it is not standard and generally no standard data is collected.

The only exception is the Energy Regulatory Office, which is obliged by law to consult stakeholders and respond to received comments (1).

Most of the sub-questions are therefore not applicable.

1) Energy Act, 458/2000 Coll. https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/2000-458#p17e

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: There is no mention of data or the publication of data in relevant laws, policies, or guidance.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework requires the publication of notice of intent in advance of public consultation processes.
The framework requires the publication of proposed regulations.
The framework requires the timely publication of a full set of public comments generated through public consultation processes.
The framework requires reasoned responses to be published alongside comments.
The framework requires the publication of final regulations and justification.
The framework requires the publication of challenges to laws and regulations that have undergone public consultation processes, as well as their results.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

indicators.justification:
Every "obliged entity", which is required to provide information through FOIA requests, is also obliged to publish annual report containing information about the FOIA requests it received.

All answers to FOIA requests and the annual reports need to be also accessible online. (1)

1) Freedom of Information Act, https://www.zakonyprolidi.cz/cs/1999-106

responses.subquestion_text: Are there laws, policies, or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?

responses.response_text: Requirements to publish this information as open data are set out in binding policy, regulations, or law.
responses.subquestion_text: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations, or guidance discuss the publication of open data?
The framework requires the collection and publication of data regarding the number of requests submitted and processed.
The framework requires the collection and publication of data regarding how long it took the relevant government agency or agencies to fill requests.
The framework requires the collection and publication of data regarding material withheld and the reasons for withholding it.
The framework requires the collection and publication of data regarding appeals to RTI determinations and their results.
The framework requires that information is linked to the relevant agency, department, or other governmental entity.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The framework requires a verification process.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.

responses.response_text: The framework covers the entire public sector.
responses.subquestion_text: How comprehensive, in terms of jurisdiction, is the framework assessed for this question?

indicators.justification:
There are many services using the data on companies. Some of them are publicly available for free, run by media. Such as Commercial register, register of companies in the Czech Republic, relations and links from justice.cz (1) or Trade Register, ARES (2)

1) Commercial register, register of companies in the Czech Republic, relations and links, https://rejstrik-firem.kurzy.cz/

2) Trade Register, ARES, https://rejstrik.penize.cz/

evidence.title: Commercial register, register of companies in the Czech Republic, relations and links from justice.cz

responses.response_text: One or more products/services exist using making use of official open government datasets.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used in products/services?
There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, government.
There is evidence of these products/services being promoted to, or used by, civil society
There is evidence of these products/services being promoted to, or used by, the private sector.
There is evidence of these products and services being promoted to, or used by, media.
There is evidence that at least one of the examples cited is making use of beneficial ownership data.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.

indicators.justification:
The topic is not part of the discourse.
There is even no public policy in this regards. This topic is not in the current party manifests for current elections.
indicators.indicator_name: Use (L): Influencing policy for gender and inclusion
indicators.indicator_name_medium: Gender and inclusion uses of data
indicators.indicator_name_short: Gender and inclusion uses of data

responses.response_text: No evidence of actors or entities using this data to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used to influence policy in the interests of more equitable land tenure and use?
There is evidence of civil society organizations using data in this way.
There is evidence of media using data in this way.
There is evidence of academics using data in this way.
There is evidence of the private sector using data in this way.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
Is there evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts on land policy?

indicators.justification:
As there are not many datasets published in this whole section, the main dataset is on sponsors of political parties. (1)

This section use the information from previous sections.

1) Annual financial reports of political parties and movements, https://www.udhpsh.cz/vyrocni-financni-zpravy-stran-a-hnuti

evidence.title: Annual financial reports of political parties and movements

responses.response_text: There are a number of cases of actors or entities using this kind of open data for accountability purposes.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of this data being used for accountability purposes?
Civil society organizations regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The media regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
Scholars or academic institutions regularly use this data for accountability purposes.
The private sector regularly uses this data for accountability purposes.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.

indicators.justification:
The main watchdog in this area is Watchdog of State (1) that uses the open data from public contracts. It provides also some analyses, K-index (2) among others.

Another important watchdog project in Z-index (3)

1) Watchdog of the State, https://www.hlidacstatu.cz/

2) Key Risk Index, https://www.hlidacstatu.cz/kindex

3) Public procurement buyers ranking. https://www.zindex.cz/

responses.response_text: There is evidence of multiple different uses involving different organisations.
responses.subquestion_text: To what extent is there evidence of this kind of data use?
There is evidence of government procurement data being presented through data-driven dashboards.
There is evidence of government procurement data being used for red flag analysis.
There is evidence that government procurement data is being analyzed to improve access to procurement opportunities for marginalized groups.
There is evidence of government procurement data being analysed to support sustainable / environmental procurement.
There are examples of government using data in these ways.
There are examples of civil society using data in these ways.
There is evidence of private sector using data in this way
At least one of the examples cited appears to make use of open procurement data.
At least one of the examples identified makes use of open beneficial ownership data.
At least one of the examples identified describes using artificial Intelligence or machine learning to process data
There is evidence that these uses have had or are having meaningful positive impacts.
